revised_title: Observations of Magnetic Inclination During the Voyage of H.M.S. 'Iron Duke' to China and Japan
tldr: Vice-Admiral Sir Charles Shadwell records observations of the magnetic inclination, or dip, during the voyage of H.M.S. 'Iron Duke' to China, Japan, and surrounding areas between 1871 and 1875. The observations were made using a dip-circle and provide data for determining secular changes in terrestrial magnetism at various locations.
